Events that occurred on 5 June.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1946 - Actor John Bach is born.
1953 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 137b.
1953 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 137c.
1955 â€“ Harvey Breit writes an article on Tolkien in the New York Times Book Review. Breit tells of "Dr. Tolkein", and contains many more errors. Tolkien later writes an angry letter about it.
1959 - J.R.R. Tolkien delivers the Valedictory Address to the University of Oxford.
1973 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 352.
1973 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to James A.H. Murray.
2003 - Andy Serkis wins the MTV Movie Award for "Best Animated Character", for his role as Gollum. His immortal acceptance speech would win the 2004 Hugo Award for "Best Dramatic Presentation, Short Form".
2004 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony at Atlanta Symphony Hall, Georgia.
2008 - Forodrim's 36th birthday celebration.

content.title: In Arda
content.content: There are no known events for this day.
